titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 741: Summula de Summa Raymundi

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Ms. Codex 741: Summula de Summa Raymundi are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

Metadata is © and licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution License version 4.0 (CC-BY-4.0 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/legalcode. For a description of the terms of use see the Creative Commons Deed https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/.

notesStmt.note: Incipit: A summis festis ad missam dicitur una.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Verse summary of Raymond of Peñaforte's Summa de poenitentia et matrimonio; canon law on marriage, simony, usury, luxury, bigamy, etc. (f. 1-20r), with a brief Bible dictionary, arranged in canonical order, not in alphabetical order (f. 20v-24).

supportDesc.extent: 24 leaves : 169 x 105 (122 x 168) mm. bound to 175 x 108 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Parchment, ii (modern paper) + i (modern parchment) + 24 + i (modern parchment) + ii (modern paper); [1-24]; modern foliation in pencil, upper and lower right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 32 long lines; frame-ruled in ink; prickings visible.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a Gothic book script by a single hand, with marginal notes in a second hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Rubricated with red used for initials, capitals and underlining.

origin.p: Written in France in the 14th century (Zacour-Hirsch).

history.provenance: Sold in the collection of the Bibliothèque Victor Luzarches at auction by Claudin, 9 March 1868.
Formerly owned by Ernest Stroehlin (bookplate, inside upper cover).
